intro: Aegopogon guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan goatherb, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features include a slender stem and white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
